channel.title: Deleting instructions
channel.description: Hello everyone, I have created a code to remove the encryption of a program (write in java). Its search with the pattern: "(SIPUSH|BIPUSH)INVOKESTATIC+". After, I insert, before the Sipush or bipush, the decrypted LDC, but when I try to delete the Sipush and the invokestatic I get a TargetLostException. I have tried all the day, but I can't solve this exception. Can you help me plz.

item.title: Deleting instructions
item.dc:creator: @gabuuzz gabuuzz
item.description:
@gabuuzz wrote:

oksuper_:

This occurs while the transformer is running?

No while I try to run nexus with modified jar.
It print a serie of number and the runtime exception.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 04, 2009, 10:27:27 am[/size][hr]Can someone help me plz… only post what you think it is…

Note: I have try to not delete everything, like super_ say:

[code]//InstructionHandle ldcH = list.insert(ih[0], ldc);
ih[2].setInstruction(ldc);
try {
//list.delete(ih[0], ih[2]);

                list.delete(ih[0],ih[1]);
            } catch (TargetLostException ex) {
                InstructionHandle[] targets = ex.getTargets();
                for (int i = 0; i < targets.length; i++) {
                    InstructionTargeter[] targeters = targets[i].getTargeters();

                    for (int j = 0; j < targeters.length; j++) {
                        targeters[j].updateTarget(targets[i], ih[2]);
                    }
                }
            }[/code]

Now only the strange serie of number appear.

Read full topic

item.title: Deleting instructions
item.dc:creator: @gabuuzz gabuuzz
item.description:
@gabuuzz wrote:

Another problem… :mad:

When I try to run it, I get a runtime exception.

This is my code:

[code]public ClassGen Transform(ClassGen cg) {
ConstantPoolGen cpg = cg.getConstantPool();
for (Method m : cg.getMethods()) {
if (m.isAbstract() || m.isNative()) {
continue;
}

        MethodGen mg = new MethodGen(m, cg.getClassName(), cg.getConstantPool());
        InstructionList list = new InstructionList(m.getCode().getCode());
        InstructionFinder finder = new InstructionFinder(list);
        for (Iterator<InstructionHandle[]> ite = finder.search("(SIPUSH|BIPUSH)INVOKESTATIC+"); ite.hasNext();) {
            InstructionHandle[] ih = ite.next();
            if (ih.length < 3) {
                continue;
            }
            int value = 0;
            if (ih[0].getInstruction() instanceof SIPUSH) {
                value = ((SIPUSH) ih[0].getInstruction()).getValue().intValue();
            } else {
                value = ((BIPUSH) ih[0].getInstruction()).getValue().intValue();
            }
            String decrypted = decrypter.Decrypt(value);
              LDC ldc = new LDC(cpg.addString(decrypted));

            InstructionHandle ldcH = list.insert(ih[0], ldc);
            try {
                list.delete(ih[0], ih[2]);
            } catch (TargetLostException ex) {
                InstructionHandle[] targets = ex.getTargets();
                for (int i = 0; i < targets.length; i++) {
                    InstructionTargeter[] targeters = targets[i].getTargeters();

                    for (int j = 0; j < targeters.length; j++) {
                        targeters[j].updateTarget(targets[i], ldcH);
                    }
                }
            }
            log("Fixed String #" + value + " by \"" + decrypted + "\"");
        }
        list.setPositions();
        mg.setInstructionList(list);
        mg.setMaxStack();
        mg.setMaxLocals();
        mg.removeLineNumbers();
        cg.replaceMethod(m, mg.getMethod());
    }
    return cg;
}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Deleting instructions
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

Because deleting only 1 instruction and setting the other handle’s instruction to the LDC is easier !![br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 03, 2009, 06:40:35 pm[/size][hr]PS Have fun cracking neXus.

Read full topic

item.title: Deleting instructions
item.dc:creator: @gabuuzz gabuuzz
item.description:
@gabuuzz wrote:

[quote=“oksuper_, post:4, topic:292744”]Reversing JShrink eh? Anyway, TargetLostException means you deleted the target of a branch. This is thrown so that you can update the target.

try { ... } catch (TargetLostException tlex) { for (InstructionHandle target : tlex.getTargets()) { for (InstructionTargeter targeter : target.getTargeters()) { targeter.update(target, newTarget); } } }

In your case, newTarget would be the InstructionHandle of the LDC.[/quote]
Thanx its work!

oksuper_:

That’s pointless though… why not just delete the SIPUSH|BIPUSH and then set the INVOKESTATIC I/I/I(I)Ljava/lang/String; InstructionHandle’s instruction to that of the LDC’s, and then have the newTarget be the previously-INVOKESTATIC’s InstructionHandle.

why only delete the SIPUSH|BIPUSH when you can delete all and insert the good string…

Read full topic

item.title: Deleting instructions
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

Reversing JShrink eh? Anyway, TargetLostException means you deleted the target of a branch. This is thrown so that you can update the target.

try { ... } catch (TargetLostException tlex) { for (InstructionHandle target : tlex.getTargets()) { for (InstructionTargeter targeter : target.getTargeters()) { targeter.update(target, newTarget); } } }

In your case, newTarget would be the InstructionHandle of the LDC.
That’s pointless though… why not just delete the SIPUSH|BIPUSH and then set the INVOKESTATIC I/I/I(I)Ljava/lang/String; InstructionHandle’s instruction to that of the LDC’s, and then have the newTarget be the previously-INVOKESTATIC’s InstructionHandle.

Read full topic

item.title: Deleting instructions
item.dc:creator: @gabuuzz gabuuzz
item.description:
@gabuuzz wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:2, topic:292744”]http://bcel.sourceforge.net/docs/de/fub/bytecode/generic/TargetLostException.html

^ has an example of how to deal with the exception[/quote]
Yes I have see that, but I don’t know what to put for new_target (targeters[j].updateTarget(targets[i], new_target)

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

http://bcel.sourceforge.net/docs/de/fub/bytecode/generic/TargetLostException.html

^ has an example of how to deal with the exception

item.title: Deleting instructions
item.dc:creator: @gabuuzz gabuuzz
item.description:
@gabuuzz wrote:

Hello everyone,
I have created a code to remove the encryption of a program (write in java). Its search with the pattern: “(SIPUSH|BIPUSH)INVOKESTATIC+”. After, I insert, before the Sipush or bipush, the decrypted LDC, but when I try to delete the Sipush and the invokestatic I get a TargetLostException. I have tried all the day, but I can’t solve this exception.
Can you help me plz.

Read full topic
